poem:
"Policy Prayer"

A decree fell as stone from high temple,
Upon the pews of silent youth,
Dividing minds in hallowed halls.
As God in quiet does dwell.
Yet, in the heart's theology,
No edict may quell the divine dialogue;
In schools or sky, no prayer can ever truly die,
For faith bespeaks in whispers, where bans falter.
